com.ikalagaming.entity

Class InventorySlot

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ikalagaming.entity.InventorySlot

  • public class InventorySlot
extends java.lang.Object
    A slot in an inventory that holds an ItemStack. This may be empty.
    Author:
    Ches Burks

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      InventorySlot()
      Constructs an empty InventorySlot.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean canMergeWith(ItemStack other)
      Returns true if the other stack can stack with this item type, and this stack has enough space to accommodate the other stack.
      ItemStack combineItemStacks(ItemStack toAdd)
      Try to combine this item stack with another.
      ItemStack getItemStack()
      Returns the pointer to the ItemStack object.
      boolean isEmpty()
      Returns true if the item stack is empty, false otherwise.
      ItemStack setEmpty()
      Sets the current stack to nothing and returns the old stack if it exists.
      ItemStack setItemStack(ItemStack newStack)
      Sets the ItemStack to the specified ItemStack and returns the old stack.
      ItemStack takeItems(int count)
      Tries to take the requested amount of items from the stack and return it in a new stack.

    • Constructor Detail

      • InventorySlot

        public InventorySlot()
        Constructs an empty InventorySlot.

    • Method Detail

      • canMergeWith

        public boolean canMergeWith(ItemStack other)
        Returns true if the other stack can stack with this item type, and this stack has enough space to accommodate the other stack.
        Parameters:
        other - The stack to test combining with
        Returns:
        True if the stacks can be combined, false otherwise

      • combineItemStacks

        public ItemStack combineItemStacks(ItemStack toAdd)
        Try to combine this item stack with another. If there are now more items than the maximum stack size allowed by the current item, then extra items are returned in a stack.
        Parameters:
        toAdd - The stack to combine with this stack
        Returns:
        A stack of overflow items

      • getItemStack

        public ItemStack getItemStack()
        Returns the pointer to the ItemStack object.
        Returns:
        The current ItemStack

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Returns true if the item stack is empty, false otherwise.
        Returns:
        True if this is empty, false otherwise

      • setEmpty

        public ItemStack setEmpty()
        Sets the current stack to nothing and returns the old stack if it exists.
        Returns:
        The old stack. This may be null.

      • setItemStack

        public ItemStack setItemStack(ItemStack newStack)
        Sets the ItemStack to the specified ItemStack and returns the old stack.
        Parameters:
        newStack - The stack to replace the old one
        Returns:
        The stack that was replaced. This may not contain items.

      • takeItems

        public ItemStack takeItems(int count)
        Tries to take the requested amount of items from the stack and return it in a new stack. If too many items are requested then it will return as many as the stack currently has. The current stack size is reduced appropriately. A negative or 0 value will return an empty stack.
        Parameters:
        count - The amount of items to take
        Returns:
        The items that were removed, in a stack form
